get.description: This API endpoint allows users to fetch a list of tasks available within the organization and retrieves task data relying on the user's permissions stored in the user token. It provides access to tasks granted by the user's specific permissions, allowing access to all relevant tasks according to the user's role, team assignments, or tasks directly assigned to the user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

parameters.name: flow
parameters.description:
List flow name that user need to get, string with comma `(,)` delimiter.
Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit,Delivery,Pickup`

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

parameters.name: doneBy
parameters.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
state of active means we only need to retrieve tasks which startTime and endTime is still relevant with the current time.
**Example:** `true`

parameters.name: isVisit
parameters.description:
state of visit means we only need to retrieve tasks which endTime is still relevant with the current time.
**Example:** `true`

parameters.name: routingResultId
parameters.description:
This key is related to the routing process. When a visit success dispatches the routingResultId will exist on task body.
**Example:** `66791ba47b28d74dab531db2`

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field.
**Example:** `createdTime`,`orderIndex`,`startTime`,`doneTime`
**Default:** `createdTime`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: timeBy
parameters.description:
Optional filter to range data between one of the following options :
**enum**: `createdTime`,`startTime`,`doneTime`
**Example:** `startTime`

parameters.name: timeFrom
parameters.description:
Used to set the start limit of the data range to retrieve based on `timeBy` with format `(Y-m-d H:i:s)`
**Example:** `2023-01-01 00:00:00`

parameters.name: timeTo
parameters.description:
Used to set the end limit of the data range to retrieve based on `timeBy` with format `(Y-m-d H:i:s)`
**Example:** `2023-01-01 23:59:59`

parameters.name: lazyLoad
parameters.description:
Used to set the lazy load mode or cursor method pagination for the task list. If set to `1`, it will ignore `page` parameter and using cursor parameter for pagination.
**Example:** `1`

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description:
Used in conjunction with `lazyLoad` parameter. If `lazyLoad` is set to `1`, this parameter will be used to get the next page of data. The value should be the last task ID
**Example:** `670391525629320817090499`

status.description: Status of response.

message.description: Message of API response.

status.description: Shows if the request was successful.

message.description: A short message explaining what went wrong.

status.description: Shows if the request was successful.

message.description: A short message explaining what went wrong.

example.message: Internal server error, please contact support@mile.app.

get.description: This API endpoint allows users to fetch a list of tasks that contain photos within the organization. The retrieved task data is based on the user's permissions stored in the user token. It filters tasks to only include those with associated photos, ensuring users access relevant tasks that contain visual documentation.

get.description: This API is designed to provide an overview of worker performance within a specific time. It enables monitoring of task completion rates, ongoing tasks, and travel metrics such as distance covered and time spent on tasks. The data is aggregated across all workers, with detailed statistics available for individual workers to facilitate in-depth analysis. The primary purpose is to track the number of tasks each worker has completed or is currently working on within the specified date. Additionally, it measures productivity by calculating the time spent on tasks and the distances traveled during task execution.

parameters.name: createdFrom
parameters.description:
A flagging for describe location history created from, default value generated by system is `mileAppField`.
**Example:** `mileAppField`.
**Default:** `null`

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
A Filter for show by specified email of user.
**Example**: `example@mile.app`

parameters.name: isSnapToRoute
parameters.description:
A flagging for calculating location history using the Snap-to-Route method. By default, the system uses the Flatten method for location history calculation.
**Example:** `1`.
**Default:** `null`

createdFrom.description: Array of string for describe location history created from.

get.description: Export logs only appear for the past 30 days and displays log data based on the user's email from the token.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on log export objects.
**Default:** `exportAt`

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

parameters.name: dataType
parameters.description:
Type to identify the export log.
**Example:** `task`

parameters.name: dataName
parameters.description:
The name of the file resulting from the export process.
**Example:** `task_6448e1c545193f0ee62de373_171367789465`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
The status indicates the progress of the export process. There are 3 logs :
`Processing` indicates that the file export process is currently underway.
`Available` indicates that the file export process has completed, and the exported file is ready for download.
`Failed` indicates that the file export process has failed, and you can view the error message in the response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
User email requesting export task. By default, use the user's email from the token.
**Example:** `john@mile.app`

requestBody.description: The API payloads for creating a task may difference from other API payloads, as tasks are parts of a flow, thus their attributes dynamically adjust to the respective task's flow. There are 2 easy ways to easily create a payload task: ### Generate payload from API 1. Send request endpoint GET /flow/{flowName}/task 2. Copy the response from section `bodyRequest` ### Generate payload from UI 1. Visit https://web.mile.app/flow/flow 2. Select Flow. 3. Open **Configuration** tab. 4. Click **API Example**. 5. Finnaly, there will be a complete description to create a task according to chosen flow. 6. Also its able to click **Copy Curl** for copy the generated request body based on the selected flow that can be used for create task.

hubIdInPath.name: hubId
hubIdInPath.description:
Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

hubIdInQuery.name: hubId
hubIdInQuery.description:
Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

limitInQuery.name: limit
limitInQuery.description: Specifies the maximum number of items to retrieve in a single request. **Example:** `10`

pageInQuery.name: page
pageInQuery.description: The page number of results to retrieve. **Example:** `2`

bearerAuth.description: Use a valid Bearer token to authenticate.

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use GET /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

field1.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use GET /flow/{flowName}/task API to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Jack Ward`

field2.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use GET /flow/{flowName}/task API to get example of payload.
**Example:** `Gambir Jakarta`

field3.description:
This field's type & value is according to Flow's setting. Use GET /flow/{flowName}/task API to get example of payload.
**Example:** `-6.230815251,106.75684387`

startTime.description:
Start time refers to the designated time for users to begin a task. If `startTime` is not provided, it will default to the configured time in the flow. You can view the datetime format here.
**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

endTime.description:
End time is the deadline for completing a task. If `endTime` is not specified, it will default to the configured time in the flow.The task cannot be completed if the date has passed the `endtime`. You can view the datetime format here
**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub. To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

flow.description:
The unique name of organization's flow. Use GET /flows API to get the list of flow names.
**Example:** `Visit`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

field1.description:

**Example:** `John Birdy`

**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

background.description:
When the background parameter is set to `true` , the action will be processed in the background. In this mode, the API call will return quickly with a response indicating that the create task request has been received and is being processed asynchronously in the background. When the background parameter is set to `false` (default), the create task will be processed directly via API. This means that the API call will wait for the create task process to complete before returning the results to the user.
**Default:** `false`.

tasks.description: The maximum data for creating multiple tasks is 2000 data.

download.description:
File type that user want to download. There are 2 types of `download`:
**enum**: `json`,`xlsx`
**Example:** `xlsx`

fields.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

doneBy.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

assignee.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

status.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

flowId.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use Flow /flows API to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

hubId.description: Fundamental entity within an organization, serving as the central point for managing various operational components. Use **GET /hubs** endpoint to get the list of Hub IDs. **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

sortBy.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on vehicle objects.
**Example:** `flow`, `assignee`, `status`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

sortOrder.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

background.description:
If the user sets the background parameter to `true`, the export process will utilize background processing, and the results will be available at GET /tasks/export-log API. If the user sets the background parameter to `false`, the export process will run directly, and the results will be immediately available in the response .
**Example:** `true`.
**Default:** `false`

exportConfigId.description:
Unique identifier for the export config for allow user to export data using their own configuration. Use **GET /export-configs** endpoint to get the list of Export Config IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

status.description: Shows if the request was successful.

message.description: A short message explaining what went wrong.
message.example: An error occurred while processing your request.
